enWisdom: A man is [gauged] by his endeavour
A person is [valued] by his endeavour [and effort], not by his [material] acquisition
The farthest endeavours are those that are closest to nobleness
The most honourable of endeavours is being careful of [fulfilling] one’s pledges

Wisdom: شَجَاعَةُ الرَّجُلِ عَلَى قَدْرِ هِمَّتِهِ وَغَيْرَتُهُ‏ عَلَى قَدْرِ حَمِيَّتِهِ
enWisdom: The courage of a man is proportionate to his ambition, and his sense of honour is equivalent to his zeal

Wisdom: طُوبَى لِمَنْ قَصَّرَ هِمَّتَهُ عَلَى مَا يَعْنِيهِ وَجَعَلَ كُلَّ جِدِّهِ لِمَا يُنْجِيهِ
enWisdom: Blessed is the one who reduces his effort in that which does not concern him and exerts all his efforts for that which will save him
One’s zeal is [proportionate] to the extent of one’s endeavour

Wisdom: مَنْ رَقَى دَرَجَاتِ الْهِمَمِ عَظَّمَتْهُ الْأُمَمُ
enWisdom: One who rises to the [higher] levels of endeavour [and determination] is glorified [and considered as great] by the nations

Wisdom: مَا رَفَعَ امْرَأً كَهِمَّتِهِ وَلَا وَضَعَهُ كَشَهْوَتِهِ
enWisdom: Nothing raises a person like his [earnest] endeavour and nothing lowers him like his lustful desire

Wisdom: لَا مُرُوَّةَ لِمَنْ لَا هِمَّةَ لَهُ
enWisdom: There is no magnanimity in one who has no determination

Wisdom: الشَّرَفُ بِالْهِمَمِ الْعَالِيَةِ لَا بِالرِّمَمِ الْبَالِيَةِ
enWisdom: Honor is attained by earnest endeavors not by worn-out bones [of one’s ancestors]
The best of qualities is honourable ambition
The best endeavours are the loftiest of them

Wisdom: كُنْ بَعِيدَ الْهِمَمِ إِذَا طَلَبْتَ كَرِيمَ الظَّفَرِ إِذَا غَلَبْتَ
enWisdom: Be lofty in your endeavours when you seek something and honourable in victory when you overpower [your enemy]
One whose endeavour is great, his care [and attention towards it] becomes great
One whose endeavour is honourable, his value becomes great
One whose endeavour is great, his cause is worthy

Wisdom: يَنْبَغِي أَنْ يَكُونَ التَّفَاخُرُ بِعَلِيِّ الْهِمَمِ وَالْوَفَاءِ بِالذِّمَمِ وَالْمُبَالَغَةِ فِي الْكَرَمِ لَا بِبَوَالِي الرِّمَمِ وَرَذَائِلِ الشِّيَمِ
enWisdom: Boasting ought to be about the greatest effort, keeping promises and being overly generous, not about the worn out bones [of one’s ancestors] and evil traits
One whose endeavour is insignificant, his merit is nullified

Wisdom: أَتْعَبُ النَّاسِ قَلْباً مَنْ عَلَتْ هِمَّتُهُ وَكَثُرَتْ مُرُوءَتُهُ وَقَلَّتْ مَقْدُرَتُهُ
enWisdom: The person who has the weariest heart is one whose endeavour is great and whose magnanimity is abundant, yet his [financial ability and] resources are minimal
Worries [and concerns] are [proportionate] to the extent of [one’s] endeavours
To the extent of endeavours, there are anxieties

Wisdom: هُمُومُ الرَّجُلِ عَلَى قَدْرِ هِمَّتِهِ وَغَيْرَتُهُ عَلَى قَدْرِ حَمِيَّتِهِ
enWisdom: The worries of a man are to the extent of his endeavour and his sense of honour is to the extent of his zeal
